definition: Book of Exodus/Second Book of Moses

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
dust/dirt/angstrom/phonetic ai or e
and/to reach/up to/in time for
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: The Israelites vow that they'll obey  Exodus 24:3, also 7b.
sentences.chinese: 在《出埃及記》第24章第3節詩7b中。
在出埃及記第一章，第九節。

sentences.english: As a foundation of a national identity, this is Moses-leading-the-Jews-of-out-Egypt type stuff.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個國家認同的基礎，類似於摩西的出埃及記。

sentences.english: That place is the Ten Commandments, found in Exodus 20.
sentences.chinese: 這個地方就是聖經十誡，出自《出埃及記》第20章。

sentences.english: Which Biblical figure led the exodus from Egypt?
sentences.chinese: 是哪個聖經人物帶領了出埃及記？

sentences.english: He says he seeks to give the two central institutions of Torah.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他試圖找到《出埃及記》中最中心的兩個機構。

sentences.english: The Exodus story also contains many Egyptian elements.
sentences.chinese: 出埃及記》故事中也有大量的埃及元素。

sentences.english: Of course, this includes the Ten Commandments found in Exodus 20.
sentences.chinese: 無疑這其中包括出埃及記20中的十戒。

sentences.english: The book of Exodus is really the sequel, then, to the book of Genesis.
sentences.chinese: 出埃及記》其實是《創世紀》的續篇。
